title: SS.PT.007
prompt:
Which statement best summarizes changes in Taiwan’s imports from 1991 to 2001?

Between 1991 and 2001, Taiwan imported
feedback: The distribution of Taiwan’s imports was more diverse in 2001 than in 1991. The U.S., Japan, and Hong Kong (located in China) are the only three single countries listed on the chart. Taiwan imported a smaller percentage of goods from each of these three countries between 1991 and 2001. Imports from Europe also decreased. The percentage of imports from ASEAN, the Association of Southeast Asian Nations, and the “other” category went up. Both of these categories contain multiple nations, indicating a greater percentage of imports come from more diverse countries.
